availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: I, Fenton M. Henderson, a Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky do swear that I will faithfully execute and fulfil the duties of Commissioner as aforesaid. So help me God.

Virginia
Clerk's office of the County Court of Loudon County, to wit

I, Charles P. Janney, Clerk of the said court, in the State aforesaid, hereby certify, that Fenton M. Henderson, within named, this day personally appeared before me, in said office, and made oath in due form, that he would faithfully execute and fulfil duties of his office as Commissioner of deeds for the state of Kentucky, according to law:
In testimony whereof, I hereto set my hand, and affix the seal of the said court, at Leesburg, the 5th day of September, 1865.

Chs P. Janney
C. C.
County Seal
Sep 5 1865 X

Comr Deeds
Virginia
Oath of F. M. Henderson
filed 20 Sept/65
